str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Festus. Of Latin derivation; festal; Phestus, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From teros; to guard, i.e. To note; by implication, to detain; by extension, to withhold; by extension, to withhold.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From Kaisar; Caesaria, the name of two places in Palestine.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From ek and poreuomai; to depart, be discharged, proceed, project.
Quickness, speed; hastily, immediately. From the same as tachus; a brief space, i.e. in haste.
